job_description:
Sr. DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead our cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and foster a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure secure, reliable, and future-ready systems, applications, and cloud environments.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, vulnerability scans, penetration testing, and execute mitigation plans.
  • Architect and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture, ensuring secure design and development practices.
  • Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design secure cloud architectures across AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments.
  • Build and secure containerized environments with Docker and Kubernetes, enforcing security baselines.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems for infrastructure and applications.
  • Optimize system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance for critical workloads.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development, automation, and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, process improvements, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security, performance, and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with strong security exposure.
  • Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions).
  • Expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud platforms with a focus on secure architecture.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Strong networking knowledge (LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers).
  • Familiarity with security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Experience with monitoring/logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM).
  • Scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell).
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills to influence engineering teams.

Contact: Share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior DevSecOps Engineer leading cybersecurity and infrastructure automation, modernizing secure CI/CD pipelines and cloud architectures. Requires 4-8 years experience with Terraform, Ansible, and AWS.

job_description:
About the Role

At 2Base, we are rebuilding the Business Analyst function into a world-class, product-minded, clarity-driven team. This role is not a documentation role. It is not a screen updater role. It is not a support role. This is a core Business Analyst position responsible for functional modelling, system reasoning, requirement clarity, and building the foundation for correct development.

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be the functional brain of the project. You will ensure that the right problem is understood, broken down, analysed, validated, clarified, communicated, and owned end-to-end. You will drive requirement precision, reduce rework, and enable confident and aligned delivery across teams.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst role focused on functional modeling, requirement clarity, and cross-team alignment. Requires 4+ years of experience in SaaS/product environments with strong system-level thinking.

job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience - 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles - Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation - Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control - Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly - Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes - Experience with project management systems and documentation tools - Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel - Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field

Benefits

A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: The Business Analyst translates business needs into structured documentation, ensuring clarity and traceability across development. Requires 1-4 years of experience in BRD/SRS creation and strong communication skills.

job_description:
Role Overview

We are seeking a Computer Vision Engineer with 4+ years of hands-on experience in Computer Vision, AI/ML model development, and production deployment. The ideal candidate will design, develop, deploy, and lead real-world AI solutions, including image/video analytics systems, LLM-powered components, and end-to-end deployment across cloud, on-prem, and edge environments. Technical leadership and mentoring capabilities are essential.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and deploy computer vision solutions for image and video data
  • Implement, fine-tune, and optimize object detection models (YOLO, SSD, Faster R-CNN, etc.)
  • Build real-time inference pipelines with low latency and high reliability
  • Collaborate with backend teams to expose models via APIs and services
  • Own production deployment across cloud, on-prem, and edge devices
  • Optimize models for performance, scalability, and cost efficiency
  • Lead technical discussions, guide the team, and review code/model designs
  • Maintain documentation for models, deployments, and system architecture

Required Technical Skills

Computer Vision & AI

  • Strong fundamentals in Computer Vision and Deep Learning
  • Hands-on experience with object detection, tracking, and video analytics
  • Proficiency with OpenCV for image and video processing

LLM & Generative AI

  • Experience working with Large Language Models (LLMs)
  • Knowledge of integrating CV outputs with LLMs (multimodal pipelines, RAG, AI agents, etc.)
  • Familiarity with LLM APIs, prompt engineering, and inference optimization
  • Understanding of real-world LLM deployment constraints (latency, cost, scaling)

Programming & Frameworks

  • Strong proficiency in Python
  • Experience with PyTorch or TensorFlow
  • Familiarity with dataset annotation, versioning, and experiment tracking

Deployment & Infrastructure

  • Proven experience deploying AI models into production environments
  • Strong understanding of GPU-based inference and acceleration
  • Experience with edge AI devices (e.g., NVIDIA Jetson or similar)
  • Knowledge of model optimization tools (ONNX, TensorRT, quantization, pruning)
  • Experience with Docker and containerized deployments
  • Exposure to CI/CD pipelines for ML or MLOps workflows

Education

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI/ML, Electronics, or related fields

Contact: Share your resume at mitty.j@difinitydigital.com
summary: A Computer Vision Engineer with 4+ years of experience is needed to develop and deploy AI/ML solutions, integrate LLMs, and lead technical teams in production environments.

job_description:
DevOps Engineer (AWS & On-Prem)

We are seeking a DevOps Engineer to design, build, and operate reliable, secure, and cost-efficient infrastructure across AWS and on-premises environments. This hands-on, leadership-oriented role is responsible for infrastructure provisioning, system reliability, CI/CD orchestration, container platforms, security controls, and cost optimization. You will collaborate with engineering and product teams to ensure scalable, observable, and resilient systems while mentoring junior DevOps engineers.

Key Responsibilities

Infrastructure & Platform Engineering - Design, provision, and manage infrastructure across AWS and on-prem environments using Infrastructure as Code (IaC). - Provision and manage Linux-based servers, virtual machines, and bare-metal systems. - Configure and manage network components including VPCs, subnets, routing, firewalls, load balancers, VPNs, and network switches (on-prem). - Lead setup and maintenance of PostgreSQL databases, including backups, replication, performance tuning, and high availability.

Containerization & Orchestration - Design, deploy, and operate Kubernetes clusters (EKS and/or self-managed). - Build and maintain Docker-based container workflows. - Manage Kubernetes workloads, namespaces, ingress, secrets, autoscaling, and rolling deployments. - Establish best practices for container security, image scanning, and runtime hardening.

CI/CD & Automation - Design and maintain CI/CD pipelines for application and infrastructure code. - Orchestrate automated builds, tests, deployments, and rollbacks. - Implement GitOps or pipeline-driven deployment strategies. - Write and maintain automation scripts using Bash, Python, or similar scripting languages.

Monitoring, Reliability & Operations - Implement system monitoring, logging, and alerting for infrastructure and applications. - Define and track SLIs/SLOs and lead incident response and root cause analysis. - Ensure high availability, fault tolerance, and disaster recovery readiness. - Lead operational runbooks and on-call best practices.

Security & Compliance - Implement infrastructure and platform security best practices. - Manage IAM, secrets, encryption, network security, and access controls. - Support vulnerability management, patching, and audit readiness. - Collaborate with security teams to align with compliance and governance requirements.

Cost Optimization & Performance - Monitor and optimize AWS cloud spend using cost visibility and reporting tools. - Identify opportunities for rightsizing, reserved instances, autoscaling, and storage optimization. - Track on-prem infrastructure utilization and capacity planning. - Balance performance, reliability, and cost trade-offs.

Leadership & Collaboration - Act as a technical lead and mentor for DevOps engineers. - Define DevOps standards, best practices, and documentation. - Partner with engineering teams to improve developer experience and deployment velocity. - Participate in architecture discussions and infrastructure roadmap planning.

Required Qualifications

  • 3+ years of hands-on experience in DevOps, SRE, or Platform Engineering roles.
  • Strong experience with AWS (EC2, VPC, IAM, RDS, EKS, S3, CloudWatch, etc.).
  • Proven experience managing on-prem infrastructure (servers, virtualization, networking).
  • Deep Linux system administration experience.
  • Hands-on experience with PostgreSQL administration.
  • Strong knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Experience with CI/CD tools and infrastructure automation.
  • Proficiency in scripting (Bash, Python, or similar).
  • Strong understanding of infrastructure security principles.
  • Experience with monitoring, logging, and incident response.

Preferred / Nice-to-Have Qualifications

  • Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools (Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible, etc.).
  • Experience operating hybrid or multi-cloud environments.
  • Exposure to GitOps, service meshes, or advanced Kubernetes patterns.
  • Prior experience leading or mentoring DevOps engineers.
  • Experience supporting regulated or compliance-driven environments.

What Success Looks Like

  • Stable, secure, and scalable infrastructure across AWS and on-prem.
  • Highly automated provisioning and deployment pipelines.
  • Strong observability and fast incident resolution.
  • Measurable reductions in cloud and infrastructure costs.
  • Improved developer velocity and platform reliability.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at career@aabasoft.com
summary: A DevOps Engineer role focusing on AWS and on-prem infrastructure, requiring expertise in CI/CD, containers, and security, with leadership responsibilities in mentoring and system reliability.

The ideal candidate will have a strong blend of project execution, stakeholder management, and product delivery experience, working closely with Product, Engineering, QA, and Business teams to ensure timely and high-quality releases. This role focuses on delivery ownership, execution governance, and supporting product prioritization decisions.

Key Responsibilities

Product Delivery & Execution - Own end-to-end delivery of HRMS / CRM product initiatives across multiple modules and releases. - Translate product roadmaps and business requirements into executable project plans with clear milestones. - Ensure on-time, on-budget, and high-quality delivery of product features and enhancements. - Manage dependencies across engineering, QA, DevOps, and external vendors. - Drive release governance including release readiness, cutover planning, and go-live coordination. - Coordinate delivery across Microsoft .NET engineering teams and ensure alignment with architecture, quality, and release standards.

Stakeholder Management - Act as the primary point of contact between Product Owners, Engineering Leads, QA, and Business stakeholders. - Facilitate regular status updates, sprint reviews, release planning, and executive reporting. - Proactively identify and communicate risks, issues, and mitigation plans. - Manage escalations effectively and ensure timely resolution through stakeholder alignment.

Agile / SDLC Management - Drive Agile delivery practices (Scrum / Kanban / Hybrid) across product teams. - Lead sprint planning, backlog grooming, daily stand-ups, retrospectives, and release planning. - Ensure adherence to SDLC, quality standards, and governance processes. - Maintain RAID logs (Risks, Assumptions, Issues, Dependencies) and ensure proactive mitigation. - Coordinate UAT planning and execution with Business stakeholders, ensuring sign-offs are obtained. - Track and report delivery metrics (e.g., sprint predictability, cycle time, defect leakage / escape rate) to improve performance.

Product & Domain Alignment - Work closely with Product Managers to align execution with product vision and roadmap. - Understand HRMS / CRM domain workflows such as: - Employee lifecycle management. - Payroll, attendance, and leave management. - Performance management. - Learning & Development. - CRM lead, opportunity, and customer lifecycle management. - Ensure regulatory, compliance, and security considerations are factored into delivery.

Team Leadership & Process Improvement - Mentor and guide cross-functional teams to improve delivery predictability and velocity. - Continuously improve project management processes, metrics, and delivery frameworks. - Promote a culture of accountability, collaboration, and continuous improvement.

Analytical & Soft Skills
